AAAAAA.purpose: SLATEC Common Mathematical Library disclaimer and version

AVINT.purpose: Integrate a function tabulated at arbitrarily spaced abscissas using overlapping parabolas

BESI.purpose: Compute an N member sequence of I Bessel functions I/SUB(ALPHA+K-1)/(X), K=1,...,N or scaled Bessel functions EXP(-X)*I/SUB(ALPHA+K-1)/(X), K=1,...,N for non-negative ALPHA and X

BESJ.purpose: Compute an N member sequence of J Bessel functions J/SUB(ALPHA+K-1)/(X), K=1,...,N for non-negative ALPHA and X

BESK.purpose: Implement forward recursion on the three term recursion relation for a sequence of non-negative order Bessel functions K/SUB(FNU+I-1)/(X), or scaled Bessel functions EXP(X)*K/SUB(FNU+I-1)/(X), I=1,...,N for real, positive X and non-negative orders FNU

BESY.purpose: Implement forward recursion on the three term recursion relation for a sequence of non-negative order Bessel functions Y/SUB(FNU+I-1)/(X), I=1,...,N for real, positive X and non-negative orders FNU

BFQAD.purpose: Compute the integral of a product of a function and a derivative of a B-spline

BINT4.purpose: Compute the B-representation of a cubic spline which interpolates given data

BINTK.purpose: Compute the B-representation of a spline which interpolates given data

BNDACC.purpose: Compute the LU factorization of a banded matrices using sequential accumulation of rows of the data matrix. Exactly one right-hand side vector is permitted

BNDSOL.purpose: Solve the least squares problem for a banded matrix using sequential accumulation of rows of the data matrix. Exactly one right-hand side vector is permitted

BSKIN.purpose: Compute repeated integrals of the K-zero Bessel function

BSPDOC.purpose: Documentation for BSPLINE, a package of subprograms for working with piecewise polynomial functions in B-representation

BSPDR.purpose: Use the B-representation to construct a divided difference table preparatory to a (right) derivative calculation

BSPEV.purpose: Calculate the value of the spline and its derivatives from the B-representation

BSPPP.purpose: Convert the B-representation of a B-spline to the piecewise polynomial (PP) form

BSPVD.purpose: Calculate the value and all derivatives of order less than NDERIV of all basis functions which do not vanish at X

BSPVN.purpose: Calculate the value of all (possibly) nonzero basis functions at X

BSQAD.purpose: Compute the integral of a K-th order B-spline using the B-representation

BVALU.purpose: Evaluate the B-representation of a B-spline at X for the function value or any of its derivatives

BVSUP.purpose: Solve a linear two-point boundary value problem using superposition coupled with an orthonormalization procedure and a variable-step integration scheme

C1MERG.purpose: Merge two strings of complex numbers. Each string is ascending by the real part

CAIRY.purpose: Compute the Airy function Ai(z) or its derivative dAi/dz for complex argument z. A scaling option is available to help avoid underflow and overflow

CBESH.purpose: Compute a sequence of the Hankel functions H(m,a,z) for superscript m=1 or 2, real nonnegative orders a=b, b+1,... where b>0, and nonzero complex argument z. A scaling option is available to help avoid overflow

CBESI.purpose: Compute a sequence of the Bessel functions I(a,z) for complex argument z and real nonnegative orders a=b,b+1, b+2,... where b>0. A scaling option is available to help avoid overflow

CBESJ.purpose: Compute a sequence of the Bessel functions J(a,z) for complex argument z and real nonnegative orders a=b,b+1, b+2,... where b>0. A scaling option is available to help avoid overflow

CBESK.purpose: Compute a sequence of the Bessel functions K(a,z) for complex argument z and real nonnegative orders a=b,b+1, b+2,... where b>0. A scaling option is available to help avoid overflow

CBESY.purpose: Compute a sequence of the Bessel functions Y(a,z) for complex argument z and real nonnegative orders a=b,b+1, b+2,... where b>0. A scaling option is available to help avoid overflow

CBINU.purpose: Subsidiary to CAIRY, CBESH, CBESI, CBESJ, CBESK and CBIRY

CBIRY.purpose: Compute the Airy function Bi(z) or its derivative dBi/dz for complex argument z. A scaling option is available to help avoid overflow

CBKNU.purpose: Subsidiary to CAIRY, CBESH, CBESI and CBESK

CDCOR.purpose: Subroutine CDCOR computes corrections to the Y array

CDCST.purpose: CDCST sets coefficients used by the core integrator CDSTP

CDIV.purpose: Compute the complex quotient of two complex numbers

CDNTL.purpose: Subroutine CDNTL is called to set parameters on the first call to CDSTP, on an internal restart, or when the user has altered MINT, MITER, and/or H

CDNTP.purpose: Subroutine CDNTP interpolates the K-th derivative of Y at TOUT, using the data in the YH array. If K has a value greater than NQ, the NQ-th derivative is calculated

CDPSC.purpose: Subroutine CDPSC computes the predicted YH values by effectively multiplying the YH array by the Pascal triangle matrix when KSGN is +1, and performs the inverse function when KSGN is -1

CDPST.purpose: Subroutine CDPST evaluates the Jacobian matrix of the right hand side of the differential equations

CDRIV1.purpose: The function of CDRIV1 is to solve N (200 or fewer) ordinary differential equations of the form dY(I)/dT = F(Y(I),T), given the initial conditions Y(I) = YI. CDRIV1 allows complex-valued differential equations

CDRIV2.purpose: The function of CDRIV2 is to solve N ordinary differential equations of the form dY(I)/dT = F(Y(I),T), given the initial conditions Y(I) = YI. The program has options to allow the solution of both stiff and non-stiff differential equations. CDRIV2 allows complex-valued differential equations

CDRIV3.purpose: The function of CDRIV3 is to solve N ordinary differential equations of the form dY(I)/dT = F(Y(I),T), given the initial conditions Y(I) = YI. The program has options to allow the solution of both stiff and non-stiff differential equations. Other important options are available. CDRIV3 allows complex-valued differential equations

CDSCL.purpose: Subroutine CDSCL rescales the YH array whenever the step size is changed

CDSTP.purpose: CDSTP performs one step of the integration of an initial value problem for a system of ordinary differential equations

CDZRO.purpose: CDZRO searches for a zero of a function F(N, T, Y, IROOT) between the given values B and C until the width of the interval (B, C) has collapsed to within a tolerance specified by the stopping criterion, ABS(B - C) .LE. 2.*(RW*ABS(B) + AE)

CGEEV.purpose: Compute the eigenvalues and, optionally, the eigenvectors of a complex general matrix

CGEFS.purpose: Solve a general system of linear equations

CGEIR.purpose: Solve a general system of linear equations. Iterative refinement is used to obtain an error estimate

CHIEV.purpose: Compute the eigenvalues and, optionally, the eigenvectors of a complex Hermitian matrix

CHKDER.purpose: Check the gradients of M nonlinear functions in N variables, evaluated at a point X, for consistency with the functions themselves

CKSCL.purpose: Subsidiary to CBKNU, CUNK1 and CUNK2

CNBCO.purpose: Factor a band matrix using Gaussian elimination and estimate the condition number

CNBDI.purpose: Compute the determinant of a band matrix using the factors computed by CNBCO or CNBFA

CNBFA.purpose: Factor a band matrix by elimination

CNBFS.purpose: Solve a general nonsymmetric banded system of linear equations

CNBIR.purpose: Solve a general nonsymmetric banded system of linear equations. Iterative refinement is used to obtain an error estimate

CNBSL.purpose: Solve a complex band system using the factors computed by CNBCO or CNBFA

CPOFS.purpose: Solve a positive definite symmetric complex system of linear equations

CPOIR.purpose: Solve a positive definite Hermitian system of linear equations. Iterative refinement is used to obtain an error estimate

CPQR79.purpose: Find the zeros of a polynomial with complex coefficients

CPZERO.purpose: Find the zeros of a polynomial with complex coefficients

CRATI.purpose: Subsidiary to CBESH, CBESI and CBESK

CSROOT.purpose: Compute the complex square root of a complex number

CUCHK.purpose: Subsidiary to SERI, CUOIK, CUNK1, CUNK2, CUNI1, CUNI2 and CKSCL

CUOIK.purpose: Subsidiary to CBESH, CBESI and CBESK

CV.purpose: Evaluate the variance function of the curve obtained by the constrained B-spline fitting subprogram FC

D1MACH.purpose: Return floating point machine dependent constants

D1MERG.purpose: Merge two strings of ascending double precision numbers

DAVINT.purpose: Integrate a function tabulated at arbitrarily spaced abscissas using overlapping parabolas

DBESI.purpose: Compute an N member sequence of I Bessel functions I/SUB(ALPHA+K-1)/(X), K=1,...,N or scaled Bessel functions EXP(-X)*I/SUB(ALPHA+K-1)/(X), K=1,...,N for nonnegative ALPHA and X

DBESJ.purpose: Compute an N member sequence of J Bessel functions J/SUB(ALPHA+K-1)/(X), K=1,...,N for non-negative ALPHA and X

DBESK.purpose: Implement forward recursion on the three term recursion relation for a sequence of non-negative order Bessel functions K/SUB(FNU+I-1)/(X), or scaled Bessel functions EXP(X)*K/SUB(FNU+I-1)/(X), I=1,...,N for real, positive X and non-negative orders FNU

DBESY.purpose: Implement forward recursion on the three term recursion relation for a sequence of non-negative order Bessel functions Y/SUB(FNU+I-1)/(X), I=1,...,N for real, positive X and non-negative orders FNU

DBFQAD.purpose: Compute the integral of a product of a function and a derivative of a K-th order B-spline

DBINT4.purpose: Compute the B-representation of a cubic spline which interpolates given data

DBINTK.purpose: Compute the B-representation of a spline which interpolates given data

DBNDAC.purpose: Compute the LU factorization of a banded matrices using sequential accumulation of rows of the data matrix. Exactly one right-hand side vector is permitted

DBNDSL.purpose: Solve the least squares problem for a banded matrix using sequential accumulation of rows of the data matrix. Exactly one right-hand side vector is permitted

DBOCLS.purpose: Solve the bounded and constrained least squares problem consisting of solving the equation E*X = F (in the least squares sense) subject to the linear constraints C*X = Y

DBOLS.purpose: Solve the problem E*X = F (in the least squares sense) with bounds on selected X values

DBSKIN.purpose: Compute repeated integrals of the K-zero Bessel function

DBSPDR.purpose: Use the B-representation to construct a divided difference table preparatory to a (right) derivative calculation

DBSPEV.purpose: Calculate the value of the spline and its derivatives from the B-representation

DBSPPP.purpose: Convert the B-representation of a B-spline to the piecewise polynomial (PP) form

DBSPVD.purpose: Calculate the value and all derivatives of order less than NDERIV of all basis functions which do not vanish at X

DBSPVN.purpose: Calculate the value of all (possibly) nonzero basis functions at X

DBSQAD.purpose: Compute the integral of a K-th order B-spline using the B-representation

DBVALU.purpose: Evaluate the B-representation of a B-spline at X for the function value or any of its derivatives

DBVSUP.purpose: Solve a linear two-point boundary value problem using superposition coupled with an orthonormalization procedure and a variable-step integration scheme

DCKDER.purpose: Check the gradients of M nonlinear functions in N variables, evaluated at a point X, for consistency with the functions themselves

DCOV.purpose: Calculate the covariance matrix for a nonlinear data fitting problem. It is intended to be used after a successful return from either DNLS1 or DNLS1E

DCV.purpose: Evaluate the variance function of the curve obtained by the constrained B-spline fitting subprogram DFC

DDAJAC.purpose: Compute the iteration matrix for DDASSL and form the LU-decomposition

DDASSL.purpose: This code solves a system of differential/algebraic equations of the form G(T,Y,YPRIME) = 0

DDASTP.purpose: Perform one step of the DDASSL integration

DDAWTS.purpose: Set error weight vector for DDASSL

DDCOR.purpose: Subroutine DDCOR computes corrections to the Y array

DDCST.purpose: DDCST sets coefficients used by the core integrator DDSTP

DDEABM.purpose: Solve an initial value problem in ordinary differential equations using an Adams-Bashforth method

DDEBDF.purpose: Solve an initial value problem in ordinary differential equations using backward differentiation formulas. It is intended primarily for stiff problems

DDERKF.purpose: Solve an initial value problem in ordinary differential equations using a Runge-Kutta-Fehlberg scheme

DDNTL.purpose: Subroutine DDNTL is called to set parameters on the first call to DDSTP, on an internal restart, or when the user has altered MINT, MITER, and/or H

DDNTP.purpose: Subroutine DDNTP interpolates the K-th derivative of Y at TOUT, using the data in the YH array. If K has a value greater than NQ, the NQ-th derivative is calculated

DDPSC.purpose: Subroutine DDPSC computes the predicted YH values by effectively multiplying the YH array by the Pascal triangle matrix when KSGN is +1, and performs the inverse function when KSGN is -1

DDPST.purpose: Subroutine DDPST evaluates the Jacobian matrix of the right hand side of the differential equations

DDRIV1.purpose: The function of DDRIV1 is to solve N (200 or fewer) ordinary differential equations of the form dY(I)/dT = F(Y(I),T), given the initial conditions Y(I) = YI. DDRIV1 uses double precision arithmetic

DDRIV2.purpose: The function of DDRIV2 is to solve N ordinary differential equations of the form dY(I)/dT = F(Y(I),T), given the initial conditions Y(I) = YI. The program has options to allow the solution of both stiff and non-stiff differential equations. DDRIV2 uses double precision arithmetic

DDRIV3.purpose: The function of DDRIV3 is to solve N ordinary differential equations of the form dY(I)/dT = F(Y(I),T), given the initial conditions Y(I) = YI. The program has options to allow the solution of both stiff and non-stiff differential equations. Other important options are available. DDRIV3 uses double precision arithmetic

DDSCL.purpose: Subroutine DDSCL rescales the YH array whenever the step size is changed

DDSTP.purpose: DDSTP performs one step of the integration of an initial value problem for a system of ordinary differential equations

DDZRO.purpose: DDZRO searches for a zero of a function F(N, T, Y, IROOT) between the given values B and C until the width of the interval (B, C) has collapsed to within a tolerance specified by the stopping criterion, ABS(B - C) .LE. 2.*(RW*ABS(B) + AE)

DEABM.purpose: Solve an initial value problem in ordinary differential equations using an Adams-Bashforth method

DEBDF.purpose: Solve an initial value problem in ordinary differential equations using backward differentiation formulas. It is intended primarily for stiff problems

DEFC.purpose: Fit a piecewise polynomial curve to discrete data. The piecewise polynomials are represented as B-splines. The fitting is done in a weighted least squares sense

DERKF.purpose: Solve an initial value problem in ordinary differential equations using a Runge-Kutta-Fehlberg scheme

DEXINT.purpose: Compute an M member sequence of exponential integrals E(N+K,X), K=0,1,...,M-1 for N .GE. 1 and X .GE. 0

DFC.purpose: Fit a piecewise polynomial curve to discrete data. The piecewise polynomials are represented as B-splines. The fitting is done in a weighted least squares sense. Equality and inequality constraints can be imposed on the fitted curve

DFZERO.purpose: Search for a zero of a function F(X) in a given interval (B,C). It is designed primarily for problems where F(B) and F(C) have opposite signs

DGAMLN.purpose: Compute the logarithm of the Gamma function

DGAUS8.purpose: Integrate a real function of one variable over a finite interval using an adaptive 8-point Legendre-Gauss algorithm. Intended primarily for high accuracy integration or integration of smooth functions

DGEFS.purpose: Solve a general system of linear equations

DGLSS.purpose: Solve a linear least squares problems by performing a QR factorization of the input matrix using Householder transformations. Emphasis is put on detecting possible rank deficiency

DH12.purpose: Subsidiary to DHFTI, DLSEI and DWNNLS

DHFTI.purpose: Solve a least squares problem for banded matrices using sequential accumulation of rows of the data matrix. Exactly one right-hand side vector is permitted

DHSTRT.purpose: Subsidiary to DDEABM, DDEBDF and DDERKF

DHVNRM.purpose: Subsidiary to DDEABM, DDEBDF and DDERKF

DINTP.purpose: Approximate the solution at XOUT by evaluating the polynomial computed in DSTEPS at XOUT. Must be used in conjunction with DSTEPS

DINTRV.purpose: Compute the largest integer ILEFT in 1 .LE. ILEFT .LE. LXT such that XT(ILEFT) .LE. X where XT(*) is a subdivision of the X interval

DLLSIA.purpose: Solve linear least squares problems by performing a QR factorization of the input matrix using Householder transformations. Emphasis is put on detecting possible rank deficiency

DLSEI.purpose: Solve a linearly constrained least squares problem with equality and inequality constraints, and optionally compute a covariance matrix

DNBCO.purpose: Factor a band matrix using Gaussian elimination and estimate the condition number

DNBDI.purpose: Compute the determinant of a band matrix using the factors computed by DNBCO or DNBFA

DNBFA.purpose: Factor a band matrix by elimination

DNBFS.purpose: Solve a general nonsymmetric banded system of linear equations

DNBSL.purpose: Solve a real band system using the factors computed by DNBCO or DNBFA

DNLS1.purpose: Minimize the sum of the squares of M nonlinear functions in N variables by a modification of the Levenberg-Marquardt algorithm

DNLS1E.purpose: An easy-to-use code which minimizes the sum of the squares of M nonlinear functions in N variables by a modification of the Levenberg-Marquardt algorithm

DNSQ.purpose: Find a zero of a system of a N nonlinear functions in N variables by a modification of the Powell hybrid method

DNSQE.purpose: An easy-to-use code to find a zero of a system of N nonlinear functions in N variables by a modification of the Powell hybrid method

DP1VLU.purpose: Use the coefficients generated by DPOLFT to evaluate the polynomial fit of degree L, along with the first NDER of its derivatives, at a specified point

DPCOEF.purpose: Convert the DPOLFT coefficients to Taylor series form

DPFQAD.purpose: Compute the integral on (X1,X2) of a product of a function F and the ID-th derivative of a B-spline, (PP-representation)

DPLINT.purpose: Produce the polynomial which interpolates a set of discrete data points

DPOFS.purpose: Solve a positive definite symmetric system of linear equations

DPOLCF.purpose: Compute the coefficients of the polynomial fit (including Hermite polynomial fits) produced by a previous call to POLINT

DPOLFT.purpose: Fit discrete data in a least squares sense by polynomials in one variable

DPOLVL.purpose: Calculate the value of a polynomial and its first NDER derivatives where the polynomial was produced by a previous call to DPLINT

DPPERM.purpose: Rearrange a given array according to a prescribed permutation vector

DPPQAD.purpose: Compute the integral on (X1,X2) of a K-th order B-spline using the piecewise polynomial (PP) representation

DPPVAL.purpose: Calculate the value of the IDERIV-th derivative of the B-spline from the PP-representation

DPSIFN.purpose: Compute derivatives of the Psi function

DPSORT.purpose: Return the permutation vector generated by sorting a given array and, optionally, rearrange the elements of the array. The array may be sorted in increasing or decreasing order. A slightly modified quicksort algorithm is used

DQAG.purpose: The routine calculates an approximation result to a given definite integral I = integral of F over (A,B), hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy ABS(I-RESULT)LE.MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(I))

DQAGE.purpose: The routine calculates an approximation result to a given definite integral I = Integral of F over (A,B), hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy ABS(I-RESLT).LE.MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(I))

DQAGI.purpose: The routine calculates an approximation result to a given INTEGRAL I = Integral of F over (BOUND,+INFINITY) OR I = Integral of F over (-INFINITY,BOUND) OR I = Integral of F over (-INFINITY,+INFINITY) Hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy ABS(I-RESULT).LE.MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(I))

DQAGIE.purpose: The routine calculates an approximation result to a given integral I = Integral of F over (BOUND,+INFINITY) or I = Integral of F over (-INFINITY,BOUND) or I = Integral of F over (-INFINITY,+INFINITY), hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy ABS(I-RESULT).LE.MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(I))

DQAGP.purpose: The routine calculates an approximation result to a given definite integral I = Integral of F over (A,B), hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy break points of the integration interval, where local difficulties of the integrand may occur (e.g. SINGULARITIES, DISCONTINUITIES), are provided by the user

DQAGPE.purpose: Approximate a given definite integral I = Integral of F over (A,B), hopefully satisfying the accuracy claim: ABS(I-RESULT).LE.MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(I)). Break points of the integration interval, where local difficulties of the integrand may occur (e.g. singularities or discontinuities) are provided by the user

DQAGS.purpose: The routine calculates an approximation result to a given Definite integral I = Integral of F over (A,B), Hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy ABS(I-RESULT).LE.MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(I))

DQAGSE.purpose: The routine calculates an approximation result to a given definite integral I = Integral of F over (A,B), hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy ABS(I-RESULT).LE.MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(I))

DQAWC.purpose: The routine calculates an approximation result to a Cauchy principal value I = INTEGRAL of F*W over (A,B) (W(X) = 1/((X-C), C.NE.A, C.NE.B), hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy ABS(I-RESULT).LE.MAX(EPSABE,EPSREL*ABS(I))

DQAWCE.purpose: The routine calculates an approximation result to a CAUCHY PRINCIPAL VALUE I = Integral of F*W over (A,B) (W(X) = 1/(X-C), (C.NE.A, C.NE.B), hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy ABS(I-RESULT).LE.MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(I))

DQAWF.purpose: The routine calculates an approximation result to a given Fourier integral I=Integral of F(X)*W(X) over (A,INFINITY) where W(X) = COS(OMEGA*X) or W(X) = SIN(OMEGA*X). Hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy ABS(I-RESULT).LE.EPSABS

DQAWFE.purpose: The routine calculates an approximation result to a given Fourier integral I = Integral of F(X)*W(X) over (A,INFINITY) where W(X)=COS(OMEGA*X) or W(X)=SIN(OMEGA*X), hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy ABS(I-RESULT).LE.EPSABS

DQAWO.purpose: Calculate an approximation to a given definite integral I= Integral of F(X)*W(X) over (A,B), where W(X) = COS(OMEGA*X) or W(X) = SIN(OMEGA*X), hopefully satisfying the following claim for accuracy ABS(I-RESULT).LE.MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(I))

DQAWOE.purpose: Calculate an approximation to a given definite integral I = Integral of F(X)*W(X) over (A,B), where W(X) = COS(OMEGA*X) or W(X)=SIN(OMEGA*X), hopefully satisfying the following claim for accuracy ABS(I-RESULT).LE.MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(I))

DQAWS.purpose: The routine calculates an approximation result to a given definite integral I = Integral of F*W over (A,B), (where W shows a singular behaviour at the end points see parameter INTEGR). Hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy ABS(I-RESULT).LE.MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(I))

DQAWSE.purpose: The routine calculates an approximation result to a given definite integral I = Integral of F*W over (A,B), (where W shows a singular behaviour at the end points, see parameter INTEGR). Hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy ABS(I-RESULT).LE.MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(I))

DQC25C.purpose: To compute I = Integral of F*W over (A,B) with error estimate, where W(X) = 1/(X-C)

DQC25F.purpose: To compute the integral I=Integral of F(X) over (A,B) Where W(X) = COS(OMEGA*X) or W(X)=SIN(OMEGA*X) and to compute J = Integral of ABS(F) over (A,B). For small value of OMEGA or small intervals (A,B) the 15-point GAUSS-KRONRO Rule is used. Otherwise a generalized CLENSHAW-CURTIS method is used

DQC25S.purpose: To compute I = Integral of F*W over (BL,BR), with error estimate, where the weight function W has a singular behaviour of ALGEBRAICO-LOGARITHMIC type at the points A and/or B. (BL,BR) is a part of (A,B)

DQCHEB.purpose: This routine computes the CHEBYSHEV series expansion of degrees 12 and 24 of a function using A FAST FOURIER TRANSFORM METHOD F(X) = SUM(K=1,..,13) (CHEB12(K)*T(K-1,X)), F(X) = SUM(K=1,..,25) (CHEB24(K)*T(K-1,X)), Where T(K,X) is the CHEBYSHEV POLYNOMIAL OF DEGREE K

DQDOTA.purpose: Compute the inner product of two vectors with extended precision accumulation and result

DQDOTI.purpose: Compute the inner product of two vectors with extended precision accumulation and result

DQELG.purpose: The routine determines the limit of a given sequence of approximations, by means of the Epsilon algorithm of P.Wynn. An estimate of the absolute error is also given. The condensed Epsilon table is computed. Only those elements needed for the computation of the next diagonal are preserved

DQK15.purpose: To compute I = Integral of F over (A,B), with error estimate J = integral of ABS(F) over (A,B)

DQK15I.purpose: The original (infinite integration range is mapped onto the interval (0,1) and (A,B) is a part of (0,1). it is the purpose to compute I = Integral of transformed integrand over (A,B), J = Integral of ABS(Transformed Integrand) over (A,B)

DQK15W.purpose: To compute I = Integral of F*W over (A,B), with error estimate J = Integral of ABS(F*W) over (A,B)

DQK21.purpose: To compute I = Integral of F over (A,B), with error estimate J = Integral of ABS(F) over (A,B)

DQK31.purpose: To compute I = Integral of F over (A,B) with error estimate J = Integral of ABS(F) over (A,B)

DQK41.purpose: To compute I = Integral of F over (A,B), with error estimate J = Integral of ABS(F) over (A,B)

DQK51.purpose: To compute I = Integral of F over (A,B) with error estimate J = Integral of ABS(F) over (A,B)

DQK61.purpose: To compute I = Integral of F over (A,B) with error estimate J = Integral of ABS(F) over (A,B)

DQMOMO.purpose: This routine computes modified Chebyshev moments. The K-th modified Chebyshev moment is defined as the integral over (-1,1) of W(X)*T(K,X), where T(K,X) is the Chebyshev polynomial of degree K

DQNC79.purpose: Integrate a function using a 7-point adaptive Newton-Cotes quadrature rule

DQNG.purpose: The routine calculates an approximation result to a given definite integral I = integral of F over (A,B), hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy ABS(I-RESULT).LE.MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(I))

DQPSRT.purpose: This routine maintains the descending ordering in the list of the local error estimated resulting from the interval subdivision process. At each call two error estimates are inserted using the sequential search method, top-down for the largest error estimate and bottom-up for the smallest error estimate

DQRFAC.purpose: Subsidiary to DNLS1, DNLS1E, DNSQ and DNSQE

DQWGTC.purpose: This function subprogram is used together with the routine DQAWC and defines the WEIGHT function

DQWGTF.purpose: This function subprogram is used together with the routine DQAWF and defines the WEIGHT function

DQWGTS.purpose: This function subprogram is used together with the routine DQAWS and defines the WEIGHT function

DRC.purpose: Calculate a double precision approximation to DRC(X,Y) = Integral from zero to infinity of -1/2 -1 (1/2)(t+X) (t+Y) dt, where X is nonnegative and Y is positive

DRC3JJ.purpose: Evaluate the 3j symbol f(L1) = ( L1 L2 L3) (-M2-M3 M2 M3) for all allowed values of L1, the other parameters being held fixed

DRC3JM.purpose: Evaluate the 3j symbol g(M2) = (L1 L2 L3 ) (M1 M2 -M1-M2) for all allowed values of M2, the other parameters being held fixed

DRC6J.purpose: Evaluate the 6j symbol h(L1) = {L1 L2 L3} {L4 L5 L6} for all allowed values of L1, the other parameters being held fixed

DRD.purpose: Compute the incomplete or complete elliptic integral of the 2nd kind. For X and Y nonnegative, X+Y and Z positive, DRD(X,Y,Z) = Integral from zero to infinity of -1/2 -1/2 -3/2 (3/2)(t+X) (t+Y) (t+Z) dt. If X or Y is zero, the integral is complete

DRF.purpose: Compute the incomplete or complete elliptic integral of the 1st kind. For X, Y, and Z non-negative and at most one of them zero, RF(X,Y,Z) = Integral from zero to infinity of -1/2 -1/2 -1/2 (1/2)(t+X) (t+Y) (t+Z) dt. If X, Y or Z is zero, the integral is complete

DRJ.purpose: Compute the incomplete or complete (X or Y or Z is zero) elliptic integral of the 3rd kind. For X, Y, and Z non- negative, at most one of them zero, and P positive, RJ(X,Y,Z,P) = Integral from zero to infinity of -1/2 -1/2 -1/2 -1 (3/2)(t+X) (t+Y) (t+Z) (t+P) dt

DSORT.purpose: Sort an array and optionally make the same interchanges in an auxiliary array. The array may be sorted in increasing or decreasing order. A slightly modified QUICKSORT algorithm is used

DSOS.purpose: Solve a square system of nonlinear equations

DSPLP.purpose: Solve linear programming problems involving at most a few thousand constraints and variables. Takes advantage of sparsity in the constraint matrix

DSTEPS.purpose: Integrate a system of first order ordinary differential equations one step

DULSIA.purpose: Solve an underdetermined linear system of equations by performing an LQ factorization of the matrix using Householder transformations. Emphasis is put on detecting possible rank deficiency

DWNNLS.purpose: Solve a linearly constrained least squares problem with equality constraints and nonnegativity constraints on selected variables

DXADD.purpose: To provide double-precision floating-point arithmetic with an extended exponent range

DXADJ.purpose: To provide double-precision floating-point arithmetic with an extended exponent range

DXC210.purpose: To provide double-precision floating-point arithmetic with an extended exponent range

DXCON.purpose: To provide double-precision floating-point arithmetic with an extended exponent range

DXLEGF.purpose: Compute normalized Legendre polynomials and associated Legendre functions

DXPMU.purpose: To compute the values of Legendre functions for DXLEGF. Method: backward mu-wise recurrence for P(-MU,NU,X) for fixed nu to obtain P(-MU2,NU1,X), P(-(MU2-1),NU1,X), ..., P(-MU1,NU1,X) and store in ascending mu order

DXPMUP.purpose: To compute the values of Legendre functions for DXLEGF. This subroutine transforms an array of Legendre functions of the first kind of negative order stored in array PQA into Legendre functions of the first kind of positive order stored in array PQA. The original array is destroyed

DXPNRM.purpose: To compute the values of Legendre functions for DXLEGF. This subroutine transforms an array of Legendre functions of the first kind of negative order stored in array PQA into normalized Legendre polynomials stored in array PQA. The original array is destroyed

DXPQNU.purpose: To compute the values of Legendre functions for DXLEGF. This subroutine calculates initial values of P or Q using power series, then performs forward nu-wise recurrence to obtain P(-MU,NU,X), Q(0,NU,X), or Q(1,NU,X). The nu-wise recurrence is stable for P for all mu and for Q for mu=0,1

DXPSI.purpose: To compute values of the Psi function for DXLEGF

DXQMU.purpose: To compute the values of Legendre functions for DXLEGF. Method: forward mu-wise recurrence for Q(MU,NU,X) for fixed nu to obtain Q(MU1,NU,X), Q(MU1+1,NU,X), ..., Q(MU2,NU,X)

DXQNU.purpose: To compute the values of Legendre functions for DXLEGF. Method: backward nu-wise recurrence for Q(MU,NU,X) for fixed mu to obtain Q(MU1,NU1,X), Q(MU1,NU1+1,X), ..., Q(MU1,NU2,X)

DXRED.purpose: To provide double-precision floating-point arithmetic with an extended exponent range

DXSET.purpose: To provide double-precision floating-point arithmetic with an extended exponent range

EFC.purpose: Fit a piecewise polynomial curve to discrete data. The piecewise polynomials are represented as B-splines. The fitting is done in a weighted least squares sense

ENORM.purpose: Subsidiary to SNLS1, SNLS1E, SNSQ and SNSQE

EXINT.purpose: Compute an M member sequence of exponential integrals E(N+K,X), K=0,1,...,M-1 for N .GE. 1 and X .GE. 0

FC.purpose: Fit a piecewise polynomial curve to discrete data. The piecewise polynomials are represented as B-splines. The fitting is done in a weighted least squares sense. Equality and inequality constraints can be imposed on the fitted curve

FFTDOC.purpose: Documentation for FFTPACK, a collection of Fast Fourier Transform routines

FUNDOC.purpose: Documentation for FNLIB, a collection of routines for evaluating elementary and special functions

FZERO.purpose: Search for a zero of a function F(X) in a given interval (B,C). It is designed primarily for problems where F(B) and F(C) have opposite signs

GAMLN.purpose: Compute the logarithm of the Gamma function

GAUS8.purpose: Integrate a real function of one variable over a finite interval using an adaptive 8-point Legendre-Gauss algorithm. Intended primarily for high accuracy integration or integration of smooth functions

H12.purpose: Subsidiary to HFTI, LSEI and WNNLS

HFTI.purpose: Solve a linear least squares problems by performing a QR factorization of the matrix using Householder transformations

HPPERM.purpose: Rearrange a given array according to a prescribed permutation vector

HPSORT.purpose: Return the permutation vector generated by sorting a substring within a character array and, optionally, rearrange the elements of the array. The array may be sorted in forward or reverse lexicographical order. A slightly modified quicksort algorithm is used

HSTART.purpose: Subsidiary to DEABM, DEBDF and DERKF

HVNRM.purpose: Subsidiary to DEABM, DEBDF and DERKF

I1MERG.purpose: Merge two strings of ascending integers

INTRV.purpose: Compute the largest integer ILEFT in 1 .LE. ILEFT .LE. LXT such that XT(ILEFT) .LE. X where XT(*) is a subdivision of the X interval

IPPERM.purpose: Rearrange a given array according to a prescribed permutation vector

IPSORT.purpose: Return the permutation vector generated by sorting a given array and, optionally, rearrange the elements of the array. The array may be sorted in increasing or decreasing order. A slightly modified quicksort algorithm is used

ISORT.purpose: Sort an array and optionally make the same interchanges in an auxiliary array. The array may be sorted in increasing or decreasing order. A slightly modified QUICKSORT algorithm is used

J4SAVE.purpose: Save or recall global variables needed by error handling routines

LAMW.purpose: Compute the principal branch of the Lambert W function

LLSIA.purpose: Solve a linear least squares problems by performing a QR factorization of the matrix using Householder transformations. Emphasis is put on detecting possible rank deficiency

LSAME.purpose: Test two characters to determine if they are the same letter, except for case

LSEI.purpose: Solve a linearly constrained least squares problem with equality and inequality constraints, and optionally compute a covariance matrix

NUMXER.purpose: Return the most recent error number

PCOEF.purpose: Convert the POLFIT coefficients to Taylor series form

PFQAD.purpose: Compute the integral on (X1,X2) of a product of a function F and the ID-th derivative of a B-spline, (PP-representation)

PIMACH.purpose: Subsidiary to HSTCSP, HSTSSP and HWSCSP

POLCOF.purpose: Compute the coefficients of the polynomial fit (including Hermite polynomial fits) produced by a previous call to POLINT

POLFIT.purpose: Fit discrete data in a least squares sense by polynomials in one variable

POLINT.purpose: Produce the polynomial which interpolates a set of discrete data points

POLYVL.purpose: Calculate the value of a polynomial and its first NDER derivatives where the polynomial was produced by a previous call to POLINT

PPQAD.purpose: Compute the integral on (X1,X2) of a K-th order B-spline using the piecewise polynomial (PP) representation

PPVAL.purpose: Calculate the value of the IDERIV-th derivative of the B-spline from the PP-representation

PSIFN.purpose: Compute derivatives of the Psi function

PVALUE.purpose: Use the coefficients generated by POLFIT to evaluate the polynomial fit of degree L, along with the first NDER of its derivatives, at a specified point

PYTHAG.purpose: Compute the complex square root of a complex number without destructive overflow or underflow

QAG.purpose: The routine calculates an approximation result to a given definite integral I = integral of F over (A,B), hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy ABS(I-RESULT)LE.MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(I))

QAGE.purpose: The routine calculates an approximation result to a given definite integral I = Integral of F over (A,B), hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy ABS(I-RESLT).LE.MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(I))

QAGI.purpose: The routine calculates an approximation result to a given INTEGRAL I = Integral of F over (BOUND,+INFINITY) OR I = Integral of F over (-INFINITY,BOUND) OR I = Integral of F over (-INFINITY,+INFINITY) Hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy ABS(I-RESULT).LE.MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(I))

QAGIE.purpose: The routine calculates an approximation result to a given integral I = Integral of F over (BOUND,+INFINITY) or I = Integral of F over (-INFINITY,BOUND) or I = Integral of F over (-INFINITY,+INFINITY), hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy ABS(I-RESULT).LE.MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(I))

QAGP.purpose: The routine calculates an approximation result to a given definite integral I = Integral of F over (A,B), hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy break points of the integration interval, where local difficulties of the integrand may occur(e.g. SINGULARITIES, DISCONTINUITIES), are provided by the user

QAGPE.purpose: Approximate a given definite integral I = Integral of F over (A,B), hopefully satisfying the accuracy claim: ABS(I-RESULT).LE.MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(I)). Break points of the integration interval, where local difficulties of the integrand may occur (e.g. singularities or discontinuities) are provided by the user

QAGS.purpose: The routine calculates an approximation result to a given Definite integral I = Integral of F over (A,B), Hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy ABS(I-RESULT).LE.MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(I))

QAGSE.purpose: The routine calculates an approximation result to a given definite integral I = Integral of F over (A,B), hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy ABS(I-RESULT).LE.MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(I))

QAWC.purpose: The routine calculates an approximation result to a Cauchy principal value I = INTEGRAL of F*W over (A,B) (W(X) = 1/((X-C), C.NE.A, C.NE.B), hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy ABS(I-RESULT).LE.MAX(EPSABE,EPSREL*ABS(I))

QAWCE.purpose: The routine calculates an approximation result to a CAUCHY PRINCIPAL VALUE I = Integral of F*W over (A,B) (W(X) = 1/(X-C), (C.NE.A, C.NE.B), hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy ABS(I-RESULT).LE.MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(I))

QAWF.purpose: The routine calculates an approximation result to a given Fourier integral I = Integral of F(X)*W(X) over (A,INFINITY) where W(X) = COS(OMEGA*X) or W(X) = SIN(OMEGA*X). Hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy ABS(I-RESULT).LE.EPSABS

QAWFE.purpose: The routine calculates an approximation result to a given Fourier integral I = Integral of F(X)*W(X) over (A,INFINITY) where W(X) = COS(OMEGA*X) or W(X) = SIN(OMEGA*X), hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy ABS(I-RESULT).LE.EPSABS

QAWO.purpose: Calculate an approximation to a given definite integral I = Integral of F(X)*W(X) over (A,B), where W(X) = COS(OMEGA*X) or W(X) = SIN(OMEGA*X), hopefully satisfying the following claim for accuracy ABS(I-RESULT).LE.MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(I))

QAWOE.purpose: Calculate an approximation to a given definite integral I = Integral of F(X)*W(X) over (A,B), where W(X) = COS(OMEGA*X) or W(X) = SIN(OMEGA*X), hopefully satisfying the following claim for accuracy ABS(I-RESULT).LE.MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(I))

QAWS.purpose: The routine calculates an approximation result to a given definite integral I = Integral of F*W over (A,B), (where W shows a singular behaviour at the end points see parameter INTEGR). Hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy ABS(I-RESULT).LE.MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(I))

QAWSE.purpose: The routine calculates an approximation result to a given definite integral I = Integral of F*W over (A,B), (where W shows a singular behaviour at the end points, see parameter INTEGR). Hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy ABS(I-RESULT).LE.MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(I))

QC25C.purpose: To compute I = Integral of F*W over (A,B) with error estimate, where W(X) = 1/(X-C)

QC25F.purpose: To compute the integral I=Integral of F(X) over (A,B) Where W(X) = COS(OMEGA*X) Or (WX)=SIN(OMEGA*X) and to compute J=Integral of ABS(F) over (A,B). For small value of OMEGA or small intervals (A,B) 15-point GAUSS- KRONROD Rule used. Otherwise generalized CLENSHAW-CURTIS us

QC25S.purpose: To compute I = Integral of F*W over (BL,BR), with error estimate, where the weight function W has a singular behaviour of ALGEBRAICO-LOGARITHMIC type at the points A and/or B. (BL,BR) is a part of (A,B)

QCHEB.purpose: This routine computes the CHEBYSHEV series expansion of degrees 12 and 24 of a function using A FAST FOURIER TRANSFORM METHOD F(X) = SUM(K=1,..,13) (CHEB12(K)*T(K-1,X)), F(X) = SUM(K=1,..,25) (CHEB24(K)*T(K-1,X)), Where T(K,X) is the CHEBYSHEV POLYNOMIAL OF DEGREE K

QELG.purpose: The routine determines the limit of a given sequence of approximations, by means of the Epsilon algorithm of P. Wynn. An estimate of the absolute error is also given. The condensed Epsilon table is computed. Only those elements needed for the computation of the next diagonal are preserved

QK15.purpose: To compute I = Integral of F over (A,B), with error estimate J = integral of ABS(F) over (A,B)

QK15I.purpose: The original (infinite integration range is mapped onto the interval (0,1) and (A,B) is a part of (0,1). it is the purpose to compute I = Integral of transformed integrand over (A,B), J = Integral of ABS(Transformed Integrand) over (A,B)

QK15W.purpose: To compute I = Integral of F*W over (A,B), with error estimate J = Integral of ABS(F*W) over (A,B)

QK21.purpose: To compute I = Integral of F over (A,B), with error estimate J = Integral of ABS(F) over (A,B)

QK31.purpose: To compute I = Integral of F over (A,B) with error estimate J = Integral of ABS(F) over (A,B)

QK41.purpose: To compute I = Integral of F over (A,B), with error estimate J = Integral of ABS(F) over (A,B)

QK51.purpose: To compute I = Integral of F over (A,B) with error estimate J = Integral of ABS(F) over (A,B)

QK61.purpose: To compute I = Integral of F over (A,B) with error estimate J = Integral of ABS(F) over (A,B)

QMOMO.purpose: This routine computes modified Chebyshev moments. The K-th modified Chebyshev moment is defined as the integral over (-1,1) of W(X)*T(K,X), where T(K,X) is the Chebyshev polynomial of degree K

QNC79.purpose: Integrate a function using a 7-point adaptive Newton-Cotes quadrature rule

QNG.purpose: The routine calculates an approximation result to a given definite integral I = integral of F over (A,B), hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy ABS(I-RESULT).LE.MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(I))

QPDOC.purpose: Documentation for QUADPACK, a package of subprograms for automatic evaluation of one-dimensional definite integrals

QPSRT.purpose: Subsidiary to QAGE, QAGIE, QAGPE, QAGSE, QAWCE, QAWOE and QAWSE

QRFAC.purpose: Subsidiary to SNLS1, SNLS1E, SNSQ and SNSQE

QWGTC.purpose: This function subprogram is used together with the routine QAWC and defines the WEIGHT function

QWGTF.purpose: This function subprogram is used together with the routine QAWF and defines the WEIGHT function

QWGTS.purpose: This function subprogram is used together with the routine QAWS and defines the WEIGHT function

R1MACH.purpose: Return floating point machine dependent constants

RC.purpose: Calculate an approximation to RC(X,Y) = Integral from zero to infinity of -1/2 -1 (1/2)(t+X) (t+Y) dt, where X is nonnegative and Y is positive

RC3JJ.purpose: Evaluate the 3j symbol f(L1) = ( L1 L2 L3) (-M2-M3 M2 M3) for all allowed values of L1, the other parameters being held fixed

RC3JM.purpose: Evaluate the 3j symbol g(M2) = (L1 L2 L3 ) (M1 M2 -M1-M2) for all allowed values of M2, the other parameters being held fixed

RC6J.purpose: Evaluate the 6j symbol h(L1) = {L1 L2 L3} {L4 L5 L6} for all allowed values of L1, the other parameters being held fixed

RD.purpose: Compute the incomplete or complete elliptic integral of the 2nd kind. For X and Y nonnegative, X+Y and Z positive, RD(X,Y,Z) = Integral from zero to infinity of -1/2 -1/2 -3/2 (3/2)(t+X) (t+Y) (t+Z) dt. If X or Y is zero, the integral is complete

RF.purpose: Compute the incomplete or complete elliptic integral of the 1st kind. For X, Y, and Z non-negative and at most one of them zero, RF(X,Y,Z) = Integral from zero to infinity of -1/2 -1/2 -1/2 (1/2)(t+X) (t+Y) (t+Z) dt. If X, Y or Z is zero, the integral is complete

RJ.purpose: Compute the incomplete or complete (X or Y or Z is zero) elliptic integral of the 3rd kind. For X, Y, and Z non- negative, at most one of them zero, and P positive, RJ(X,Y,Z,P) = Integral from zero to infinity of -1/2 -1/2 -1/2 -1 (3/2)(t+X) (t+Y) (t+Z) (t+P) dt

RPQR79.purpose: Find the zeros of a polynomial with real coefficients

RPZERO.purpose: Find the zeros of a polynomial with real coefficients

S1MERG.purpose: Merge two strings of ascending real numbers

SBOCLS.purpose: Solve the bounded and constrained least squares problem consisting of solving the equation E*X = F (in the least squares sense) subject to the linear constraints C*X = Y

SBOLS.purpose: Solve the problem E*X = F (in the least squares sense) with bounds on selected X values

SCOV.purpose: Calculate the covariance matrix for a nonlinear data fitting problem. It is intended to be used after a successful return from either SNLS1 or SNLS1E

SDAJAC.purpose: Compute the iteration matrix for SDASSL and form the LU-decomposition

SDASSL.purpose: This code solves a system of differential/algebraic equations of the form G(T,Y,YPRIME) = 0

SDASTP.purpose: Perform one step of the SDASSL integration

SDAWTS.purpose: Set error weight vector for SDASSL

SDCOR.purpose: Subroutine SDCOR computes corrections to the Y array

SDCST.purpose: SDCST sets coefficients used by the core integrator SDSTP

SDNTL.purpose: Subroutine SDNTL is called to set parameters on the first call to SDSTP, on an internal restart, or when the user has altered MINT, MITER, and/or H

SDNTP.purpose: Subroutine SDNTP interpolates the K-th derivative of Y at TOUT, using the data in the YH array. If K has a value greater than NQ, the NQ-th derivative is calculated

SDPSC.purpose: Subroutine SDPSC computes the predicted YH values by effectively multiplying the YH array by the Pascal triangle matrix when KSGN is +1, and performs the inverse function when KSGN is -1

SDPST.purpose: Subroutine SDPST evaluates the Jacobian matrix of the right hand side of the differential equations

SDRIV1.purpose: The function of SDRIV1 is to solve N (200 or fewer) ordinary differential equations of the form dY(I)/dT = F(Y(I),T), given the initial conditions Y(I) = YI. SDRIV1 uses single precision arithmetic

SDRIV2.purpose: The function of SDRIV2 is to solve N ordinary differential equations of the form dY(I)/dT = F(Y(I),T), given the initial conditions Y(I) = YI. The program has options to allow the solution of both stiff and non-stiff differential equations. SDRIV2 uses single precision arithmetic

SDRIV3.purpose: The function of SDRIV3 is to solve N ordinary differential equations of the form dY(I)/dT = F(Y(I),T), given the initial conditions Y(I) = YI. The program has options to allow the solution of both stiff and non-stiff differential equations. Other important options are available. SDRIV3 uses single precision arithmetic

SDSCL.purpose: Subroutine SDSCL rescales the YH array whenever the step size is changed

SDSTP.purpose: SDSTP performs one step of the integration of an initial value problem for a system of ordinary differential equations

SDZRO.purpose: SDZRO searches for a zero of a function F(N, T, Y, IROOT) between the given values B and C until the width of the interval (B, C) has collapsed to within a tolerance specified by the stopping criterion, ABS(B - C) .LE. 2.*(RW*ABS(B) + AE)

SGEEV.purpose: Compute the eigenvalues and, optionally, the eigenvectors of a real general matrix

SGEFS.purpose: Solve a general system of linear equations

SGEIR.purpose: Solve a general system of linear equations. Iterative refinement is used to obtain an error estimate

SGLSS.purpose: Solve a linear least squares problems by performing a QR factorization of the matrix using Householder transformations. Emphasis is put on detecting possible rank deficiency

SINTRP.purpose: Approximate the solution at XOUT by evaluating the polynomial computed in STEPS at XOUT. Must be used in conjunction with STEPS

SNBCO.purpose: Factor a band matrix using Gaussian elimination and estimate the condition number

SNBDI.purpose: Compute the determinant of a band matrix using the factors computed by SNBCO or SNBFA

SNBFA.purpose: Factor a real band matrix by elimination

SNBFS.purpose: Solve a general nonsymmetric banded system of linear equations

SNBIR.purpose: Solve a general nonsymmetric banded system of linear equations. Iterative refinement is used to obtain an error estimate

SNBSL.purpose: Solve a real band system using the factors computed by SNBCO or SNBFA

SNLS1.purpose: Minimize the sum of the squares of M nonlinear functions in N variables by a modification of the Levenberg-Marquardt algorithm

SNLS1E.purpose: An easy-to-use code which minimizes the sum of the squares of M nonlinear functions in N variables by a modification of the Levenberg-Marquardt algorithm

SNSQ.purpose: Find a zero of a system of a N nonlinear functions in N variables by a modification of the Powell hybrid method

SNSQE.purpose: An easy-to-use code to find a zero of a system of N nonlinear functions in N variables by a modification of the Powell hybrid method

SOS.purpose: Solve a square system of nonlinear equations

SPLP.purpose: Solve linear programming problems involving at most a few thousand constraints and variables. Takes advantage of sparsity in the constraint matrix

SPOFS.purpose: Solve a positive definite symmetric system of linear equations

SPOIR.purpose: Solve a positive definite symmetric system of linear equations. Iterative refinement is used to obtain an error estimate

SPPERM.purpose: Rearrange a given array according to a prescribed permutation vector

SPSORT.purpose: Return the permutation vector generated by sorting a given array and, optionally, rearrange the elements of the array. The array may be sorted in increasing or decreasing order. A slightly modified quicksort algorithm is used

SSIEV.purpose: Compute the eigenvalues and, optionally, the eigenvectors of a real symmetric matrix

SSORT.purpose: Sort an array and optionally make the same interchanges in an auxiliary array. The array may be sorted in increasing or decreasing order. A slightly modified QUICKSORT algorithm is used

STEPS.purpose: Integrate a system of first order ordinary differential equations one step

SVD.purpose: Perform the singular value decomposition of a rectangular matrix

ULSIA.purpose: Solve an underdetermined linear system of equations by performing an LQ factorization of the matrix using Householder transformations. Emphasis is put on detecting possible rank deficiency

WNNLS.purpose: Solve a linearly constrained least squares problem with equality constraints and nonnegativity constraints on selected variables

XADD.purpose: To provide single-precision floating-point arithmetic with an extended exponent range

XADJ.purpose: To provide single-precision floating-point arithmetic with an extended exponent range

XC210.purpose: To provide single-precision floating-point arithmetic with an extended exponent range

XCON.purpose: To provide single-precision floating-point arithmetic with an extended exponent range

XERBLA.purpose: Error handler for the Level 2 and Level 3 BLAS Routines

XERCLR.purpose: Reset current error number to zero

XERCNT.purpose: Allow user control over handling of errors

XERDMP.purpose: Print the error tables and then clear them

XERHLT.purpose: Abort program execution and print error message

XERMAX.purpose: Set maximum number of times any error message is to be printed

XERMSG.purpose: Process error messages for SLATEC and other libraries

XERPRN.purpose: Print error messages processed by XERMSG

XERSVE.purpose: Record that an error has occurred

XGETF.purpose: Return the current value of the error control flag

XGETUA.purpose: Return unit number(s) to which error messages are being sent

XGETUN.purpose: Return the (first) output file to which error messages are being sent

XLEGF.purpose: Compute normalized Legendre polynomials and associated Legendre functions

XPMU.purpose: To compute the values of Legendre functions for XLEGF. Method: backward mu-wise recurrence for P(-MU,NU,X) for fixed nu to obtain P(-MU2,NU1,X), P(-(MU2-1),NU1,X), ..., P(-MU1,NU1,X) and store in ascending mu order

XPMUP.purpose: To compute the values of Legendre functions for XLEGF. This subroutine transforms an array of Legendre functions of the first kind of negative order stored in array PQA into Legendre functions of the first kind of positive order stored in array PQA. The original array is destroyed

XPNRM.purpose: To compute the values of Legendre functions for XLEGF. This subroutine transforms an array of Legendre functions of the first kind of negative order stored in array PQA into normalized Legendre polynomials stored in array PQA. The original array is destroyed

XPQNU.purpose: To compute the values of Legendre functions for XLEGF. This subroutine calculates initial values of P or Q using power series, then performs forward nu-wise recurrence to obtain P(-MU,NU,X), Q(0,NU,X), or Q(1,NU,X). The nu-wise recurrence is stable for P for all mu and for Q for mu=0,1

XPSI.purpose: To compute values of the Psi function for XLEGF

XQMU.purpose: To compute the values of Legendre functions for XLEGF. Method: forward mu-wise recurrence for Q(MU,NU,X) for fixed nu to obtain Q(MU1,NU,X), Q(MU1+1,NU,X), ..., Q(MU2,NU,X)

XQNU.purpose: To compute the values of Legendre functions for XLEGF. Method: backward nu-wise recurrence for Q(MU,NU,X) for fixed mu to obtain Q(MU1,NU1,X), Q(MU1,NU1+1,X), ..., Q(MU1,NU2,X)

XRED.purpose: To provide single-precision floating-point arithmetic with an extended exponent range

XSET.purpose: To provide single-precision floating-point arithmetic with an extended exponent range

XSETUA.purpose: Set logical unit numbers (up to 5) to which error messages are to be sent

XSETUN.purpose: Set output file to which error messages are to be sent

ZABS.purpose: Subsidiary to ZBESH, ZBESI, ZBESJ, ZBESK, ZBESY, ZAIRY and ZBIRY

ZAIRY.purpose: Compute the Airy function Ai(z) or its derivative dAi/dz for complex argument z. A scaling option is available to help avoid underflow and overflow

ZBESH.purpose: Compute a sequence of the Hankel functions H(m,a,z) for superscript m=1 or 2, real nonnegative orders a=b, b+1,... where b>0, and nonzero complex argument z. A scaling option is available to help avoid overflow

ZBESI.purpose: Compute a sequence of the Bessel functions I(a,z) for complex argument z and real nonnegative orders a=b,b+1, b+2,... where b>0. A scaling option is available to help avoid overflow

ZBESJ.purpose: Compute a sequence of the Bessel functions J(a,z) for complex argument z and real nonnegative orders a=b,b+1, b+2,... where b>0. A scaling option is available to help avoid overflow

ZBESK.purpose: Compute a sequence of the Bessel functions K(a,z) for complex argument z and real nonnegative orders a=b,b+1, b+2,... where b>0. A scaling option is available to help avoid overflow

ZBESY.purpose: Compute a sequence of the Bessel functions Y(a,z) for complex argument z and real nonnegative orders a=b,b+1, b+2,... where b>0. A scaling option is available to help avoid overflow

ZBINU.purpose: Subsidiary to ZAIRY, ZBESH, ZBESI, ZBESJ, ZBESK and ZBIRY

ZBIRY.purpose: Compute the Airy function Bi(z) or its derivative dBi/dz for complex argument z. A scaling option is available to help avoid overflow

ZBKNU.purpose: Subsidiary to ZAIRY, ZBESH, ZBESI and ZBESK

ZDIV.purpose: Subsidiary to ZBESH, ZBESI, ZBESJ, ZBESK, ZBESY, ZAIRY and ZBIRY

ZEXP.purpose: Subsidiary to ZBESH, ZBESI, ZBESJ, ZBESK, ZBESY, ZAIRY and ZBIRY
